name: Recent Land Use / Land Cover Change
shortName: Recent Land Use / Land Cover Change
functionStatement: Runoff and infiltration sustain natural flow regime, carry appropriate sediment and nutrients from uplands, and reliably cue spawning/migration of aquatic life.
descriptionMarkdown: Magnitude of land cover/land use change over a specified period. Greater recent conversion typically increases hydrologic alteration and pollutant/sediment loading risk.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Watershed

Method: Desktop (GIS/imagery and existing datasets)
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compare land cover between two time periods (e.g., NLCD time series) and compute percent area converted (and/or change in impervious area where specified). Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Recent Land Use / Land Cover Change
inputs.helpMarkdown: Land cover time series (e.g., NLCD); watershed boundary; optional local land use change datasets.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Rural communities/slow growth or primarily forested (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Single family homes/suburban (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

references: NLCD Land Cover time series (MRLC) (if used)
